review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowSize: 128GBStyle: S25Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: I wanted to replace an iPhone Xr with an Android device.  My thought process was something like, "the Xr is REALLY old, and the S25 is one of the latest Android phones and will probably be superior in most if not all categories." Jebus cribst I was SO wrong.  First, the facial recognition - works about 20% of the time (and that's being generous).  Second, the fingerprint scanner - works about 20% of the time on the first try (and that's being generous). With my iPhone, I never needed the fingerprint because the facial recognition worked EVERY TIME with no issues. I paid for two years of Samsung Care+ when I got the phone, expecting to love it.  If I had not purchased the Samsung Care+, I would have already traded in this phone for an iPhone. Bottom line, if you are considering switching from an old iPhone, DON'T.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium BlackSize: 256GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: The build quality is very good, at least on a visible side of things. The phone is quite heavy. The battery life despite promises is not very impressive. With normal use it lasts approximately 36 hours, but if camera is used, particularly with high resolution, the battery will drain very fast since the phone heats up very badly. The screen quality is very good, especially no glare feature. I would definitely give it five stars if not a major problem. After a day of use the left part of the screen stopped responding to two finger pinching gesture for zomming in and out. It is happening with any application allowing zooming, such as Gallery, browsers, Photos, to name but a few. After a reboot it would work for a few hours, and will start again. I initiated a return with Amazon, and since Amazon wouldn't deliver a replacement on time for the return to be sent back, I purchased another one from Best Buy. And... absolutely same issue. Now both will go back because this is an absolutely unacceptable problem. Another problem that is annoying, but not critical. The sound volume jumps up and down when switching between apps. For example you are on a speaker in WhatsApp, you pick a regular phone call and switch back, the volume may jump to its maximum, or you increase the volume for phone conversation, it will also increase the ring tone volume. I have to say that I was spoiled with my older Galaxy S10 Lite, which served flowlessly for 6 years before the battery started failing.

span: Not as impressive as the S10e
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: IcyblueSize: 256GBStyle: S25Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Not as impressive as the S10e. The fingerprint sensor on the S25 is absolute garbage and a major annoyance. You never should have abandoned the one like that of the S10e. This is what happens when you try to copy Apple. ðŸ¤¨ Additionally I was obligated to purchase a charger, because Samsung no longer includes a new one when you spend close to $1k for a new phone! To add insult to injury, the charger is only MARGINALLY faster than the one included with my Samsung Galaxy S10e!! Shame on all the companies obsessed with maximizing their profits at customer expense!!!

span: Cannot update the phone with software or security updates
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium GraySize: 256GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Love the phone and trying out the new features. Upgraded from a Samsung Note 9. Of course there are differences in the way the phones work every time you get it different one. This one will not allow me to do software or security updates and say I have to use Smart switch. What a pita. The last time this was updated was December 2024 and I just got it December 2025. I shouldn't have to go to a computer to update my freaking phone. This is ridiculous. Why don't they have the phones updated before they sell them to people? Only rating is a three-star because of this extremely irritating and convenient.

span: Not much difference between this and S23 Ultra
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: IcyblueSize: 256GBStyle: S25+Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Nice little phone. Dont notice much difference between it and my S23 ultra. The ad did promise a pro subscription of Perplexity, but Perplexity AI syas the promo was over two days before i bought my phone. Someone should keep an eye on their listings. This was a $200 value and did play a part in my decision to purchase.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: JetblackSize: 256GBStyle: S25 FEPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: It works but not as great as it should. Keeps disconnecting from bluetooth on its own. Picture quality isnt as good. Noticed more pixilation issues. Color on the screen is pretty far off. Fixable to a certain extent if you mess with settings but far too bright with lack of color. Other than that the battery can last all day. Calls can be heard on the other end pretty well.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: WhiteSize: 128GBStyle: S25 FEPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Bought this unlocked Samsung 25fe on Nov. 22, Black Friday sale. Price is not the issue with this cell. Having trouble with text messages coming through, some will, some won't. I have been on every site  trying to find the fix.  It is not on do not disturb, all switches have been adjusted numerous times.  Cell can be right in front of me on the table and it won't notify me. Then sometimes it will.  Have to keep checking the messages  app to see if I missed a text. This is a royal pain. Never had a Samsung do this.  Very disappointed. I would return it but hate going through setting another one up.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium SilverblueSize: 512GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: It is a nice phone. But if I am paying 1k it needs to connect to Bluetooth. I don't need to jump through hoops to get that done. I will return it. Sadly it just failed in that department. And that is a very basic function for a phone.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: IcyblueSize: 256GBStyle: S25Pattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: Good phone, but recording a video outdoors results in ruined videos because of cracking distorted sound. Camera quality in dim light is also far from being perfect. I wouldn't buy or recommend buying this model, and I specifically chose this one for the size, because previously my wife owned s20e and was very happy with the size, so this one is the closest to old in terms of dimensions. So sad that it has this camera/sound issues.

span: I would recommend the Pixel Pro over this
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Titanium BlackSize: 256GBStyle: S25 UltraPattern Name: Phone Only
review-text: While this is a good phone, I prefer my Android Pixel Pro over the Samsung. It is far less expensive, the photo and video quality is just as good. When streaming the batteries lasted about the same time for a while, now that I have had the phones for a while it seems as though the Pixel's battery seems to be lasting longer. For the money, I think the Pixel is the best value.
